activities.loc: Branch 5 Courthouse and Law Enforcement Center

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Daniel Conry

records.addlTxt:
State by Passe in person /  Atty West via zoom / Def via zoom
West:  this is in response to letter I filed couple weeks ago.  State had no objection dropping the No Contact w/ MT.  Commissioner Kelly wouldn't take up removing the GPS House Arrest condition.  Since the No Contact was dropped in all cases - we would req the GPS & House Arrest be removed
State:  we are OK w/ dropping the GPS including House arrest
CRT:  the No Contact w/ MT should have been dropped in all files.  The GPS requirement in all files will end as well as the House Arrest
West:  def has tested positive for covid - he will bring GPS back after his quarantine period is over
Bail/bond hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
From: Atty West Re: Req GPS & house arrest be removed from bond.

CC Kelly for TWB
State by  ? /  Atty West
M.T.  not present - wants to lift no contact. State has no objection to lifting or modifying
Def:  victim has been reachout out to def & his family.  Requesting State contact victim & advise her not to contact def
Court:  No Contact is lifted

State by Passe by zoom / Atty West by zoom /  Def by zoom
CRT:  can this matter be set for plea or trial?
West:  the Assigned ADA would have to give me an offer first...we can try to set for plea togivve ADA incentive to get things going
Passe:  I had conversation w/ ADA Sanford this morning & I did send out an offer in the last few minutes
West:  req to set for plea in about 4 mos.  There may be some issues...I did let Sate know that I wanted to address bond...def's parents are hoping to take def to grandfather in TN for about a month...
Passe:  cites concerns...
Def's mother:  def would come back end of Aug
West:  we could have him report w/in 24 hrs to JSS upon his return
CRT comments...case needs to be resolved 
West req to remove House Arrest but leave the GPS on - so def can go out & get job & come to see me
CRT:  JSS is going to let def uot for any legitimate outing while on house arrest.  That doesn't concern me.  If he wants to seek job, he can get out - JSS understands this...
West / CRT comment on case
Passe:  our position is neutral.  Cites concerns - he would need to be monitored by responsible adult
CRT cites concerns & issues...
CRT WILL ALLOW FOR THE REMOVAL OF GPS & ALLOW DEF TO GO TO TN FOR THE REMAINDER OF JULY & MONTH OF AUG.  WHEN DEF RETURNS IN AUG., HE IS TO CHECK BACK IN W/ JSS & ALSO LET MS WEST KNOW THAT HE IS BACK.  
CRT:  HOUSE ARREST WILL BE BACK IN PLACE WHEN DEF RETURNS.  DEF NEEDS TO BE BACK IN TOUCH W/ JSS BY 9-1-2022.  JSS WILL REPORT TO CRT IF DEF HAS NOT BEEN IN TOUCH W/ THEM BY THEN
Plea hearing on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Calendar call on July 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Req to remove GPS & House arrest
CRT: at this point req is denied
